info.title: Payment Method
info.description:
TMF670 Defines a specific method of payment (e.g. direct debit with all details associated)
-	Main payment method attributes are its type, details, name, description, isPreffered, status, status date
Payment Method API performs the following operations on payment method.
-	Retrieval of a payment method or a collection of payment method depending on filter criteria
-	Partial update of a payment method
-	Creation of a payment method 
-	Notification of events on payment method:
o	Payment method state change
o	Payment method change
o	Payment method created
o	Payment method deleted 

\n\n\nCopyright © TM Forum 2020. All Rights Reserved\n\n\n"

PaymentMethod.description: A Payment Method is a pure-virtual super-class that defines a specific method of payment such as Direct Debit, Cash, Digital Wallet,Tokenized Card, Bank Account Transfer, Bank Account Debit, Bank Card, Voucher, Check, Bucket PaymentMethod, Account PaymentMethod, and Loyalty PaymentMethod with all details associated. Use the @type attribute to specify the concrete type in the API calls.Defines a specific method of payment (e.g. direct debit with all details associated)

name.description: Friendly name assigned to the payment method

description.description: Text description of the contents of the payment method

isPreferred.description: If the method is the preferred one by the owner. Typically used when querying for the payment methods of a specific customer or account

authorizationCode.description: Review: Authorization code provided by a financial institution. Typically this would be populated for recurring payments using the method, as payments have an authorization code of their own.

statusDate.description: The last time the payment method status changed.

statusReason.description: The reason for the last status change.

validFor.description: Date interval in which the payment method is valid

@type.description: Type of payment method (e.g.: bank card, cash, voucher,etc).

relatedParty.description: Reference to the customer or party that owns that payment method or can use it.

relatedPlace.description: Reference to a place for billing or delivery address, if different to that of the related party.

account.description: Reference to the accounts that are linked to the payment method. May be a party account or a financial account.

PaymentMethod_Create.description:
A Payment Method is a pure-virtual super-class that defines a specific method of payment such as Direct Debit, Cash, Digital Wallet,Tokenized Card, Bank Account Transfer, Bank Account Debit, Bank Card, Voucher, Check, Bucket PaymentMethod, Account PaymentMethod, and Loyalty PaymentMethod with all details associated. Use the @type attribute to specify the concrete type in the API calls.
Skipped properties: id,href

startDateTime.description: Start of the time period, using IETC-RFC-3339 format

DirectDebit.description: Direct Debit is a fully automated payment instrument which is generally used for recurrent payments. It allows a creditor to initiate the payment order. In doing so, it exempts the debtor from having to send a separate payment order at each due date

mandateType.description: The type of mandate e.g., single-use(single)/multi-use(recurring)

mandateCategory.description: The identification code of the Scheme e.g., core/b2b

signatureDate.description: The date of signing of the (e)Mandate

mandateStatusDate.description: The date of the mandate status change

firstDebitDate.description: The first debit date. The debit date of the collection is the day when the payment of the Debtor is due to the Creditor

lastDebitDate.description: The last debit date. The debit date of the collection is the day when the payment of the Debtor is due to the Creditor

cancellationDate.description: The date on which the (e)Mandate has been cancelled by the Debtor or the Creditor.

accountNumber.description: The bank account number, this could refer to the iban or swift number.

accountNumberType.description: The type of account number (e.g.: IBAN, SWIFT, ...)

reference.description: A reference that the party can later use to identify the direct debit.

BIC.description: The Business Identifier Code/Swift code of the financial institution where the account is located.

owner.description: The owner of the bank account. This is also the account name.

bank.description: The display name of the bank.

AttachmentRefOrValue.description: An attachment by value or by reference. An attachment complements the description of an element, for example through a document, a video, a picture.

id.description: Unique identifier for this particular attachment

attachmentType.description: Attachment type such as video, picture

content.description: The actual contents of the attachment object, if embedded, encoded as base64

description.description: A narrative text describing the content of the attachment

mimeType.description: Attachment mime type such as extension file for video, picture and document

url.description: Uniform Resource Locator, is a web page address (a subset of URI)

validFor.description: The period of time for which the attachment is valid

description.description: Description of the voucher i.e.: get one and receive one free.

discount.description: The discount that the voucher applies when it's a discount voucher.

TokenizedCard.description: A Tokenized Card method of payment.

brand.description: Card brand. Might be used for display purposes

cardType.description: Card type. Might be used for display purposes.

lastFourDigits.description: The last four digits of the credit card.

token.description: The token. A series of randomly generated numbers.

issuer.description: The entity that issued the token.

countryOfIssue.description: ISO 3166-1 Alpha-2 country code that designate the country where the tokenised card was issued.e.g. GB, NG, FR.

DigitalWallet.description: A digital wallet method of payment.

service.description: Organization, platform or currency backing the wallet (e.g.: PayPal, Yandex, BitCoin…).

walletUrl.description: URI pointing at the digital wallet (e.g.: //paypal.me/johndoe).

drawer.description: Person or entity writing the check.

payee.description: Person or entity the check is addressed to.

signedDate.description: Date when the check was signed.

bank.description: Bank performing the payment of the check.

Cash.description: A cash method of payment. It has no additional data, but it could be extended to add information e.g.: the cashier who took the payment, the person who paid, etc

BankCard.description: A bank card method of payment.

cardType.description: The type of card e.g. Credit, debit etc.

expirationDate.description: Expiration date of the bank card.

cvv.description: The security code (e.g.: CVV, CVV2) of the card.

lastFourDigits.description: The last four digits of the credit card.

bank.description: The bank that issued the card.

BankAccountTransfer.description: A bank transfer method of payment.

accountNumber.description: The bank account number, this could refer to the iban or swift number.

accountNumberType.description: The type of account number (e.g.: IBAN, SWIFT, ...)

BIC.description: The Business Identifier Code/Swift code of the financial institution where the account is located.

owner.description: The owner of the bank account. This is also the account name.

bank.description: The display name of the bank.

BankAccountDebit.description: A bank account debit method of payment. This could be extended to add any required authorization fields to allow recurring payments

accountNumber.description: The Bank Account Number (this could refer to the IBAN or SWIFT number)

accountNumberType.description: The type of account number (e.g.: IBAN, SWIFT, ...)

BIC.description: The Business Identifier Code/Swift code of the financial institution where the account is located.

owner.description: The owner of the bank account. This is also the account name.

bank.description: The display name of the bank.

Quantity.description: An amount in a given unit

amount.description: Numeric value in a given unit

Error.description: Used when an API throws an Error, typically with a HTTP error response-code (3xx, 4xx, 5xx)

code.description: Application relevant detail, defined in the API or a common list.

reason.description: Explanation of the reason for the error which can be shown to a client user.

message.description: More details and corrective actions related to the error which can be shown to a client user.

referenceError.description: URI of documentation describing the error.
